net.lightstone.model
Class Entity

java.lang.Object
  net.lightstone.model.Entity
Direct Known Subclasses:
ItemEntity, Mob
public abstract class Entity
extends Object

Represents some entity in the world such as an item on the floor or a player.

Author:
Graham Edgecombe

Field Summary
protected  boolean active
          A flag indicating if this entity is currently active.
protected  int id
          This entity's unique id.
protected  Position position
          The current position.
protected  Position previousPosition
          The position in the last cycle.
protected  Rotation previousRotation
          The rotation in the last cycle.
protected  Rotation rotation
          The current rotation.
protected  World world
          The world this entity belongs to.

          Creates an entity and adds it to the specified world.

isWithinDistance

public boolean isWithinDistance(Entity other)
Checks if this entity is within the Chunk.VISIBLE_RADIUS of another.

Parameters:
other - The other entity.
Returns:
true if the entities can see each other, false if not.

destroy

public void destroy()
Destroys this entity by removing it from the world and marking it as not being active.

Checks if this entity is active.

Returns:
true if so, false if not.

getId

public int getId()
Gets the id of this entity.

Returns:

pulse

public void pulse()
Called every game cycle. Subclasses should implement this to implement periodic functionality e.g. mob AI.

reset

public void reset()
Resets the previous position and rotations of the entity to the current position and rotation.
